scripts.say: Diadem of Light - Ceremonial Hall
Woah... this place is a dump... It's going to be hard to get Watatsumi out...
Indeed. Worst case scenario, we will have to conduct the ceremony right here anyway...
Lady Nagato, please hold on for a moment! I'll go dig up the ritual objects! Heave, ho...!
You're quite hardy for a destroyer...
Ehehe~ Ryuuhou often puts me through worse, so this is nothing for me!
Mikasa, are you worried about something?
Yes, it's about this ritual, but I can't quite place my finger on it...
There's... something off about all of this.
It must be serious if it's even bothering the Great Veteran~
I didn't really have anything special in mind. After all, the ceremony to tap into Watatsumi's power has always been more of a celebration, hasn't it?
Mmhm, I am in agreement. What a travesty it would be to become dependent upon the gods. We must create the future we want with our own hands.
Hehe, I knew that if anyone would understand, it'd be you, Great Veteran Mikasa.
Allow me to come clean about this ceremony. Though I have taken the initiative in using Siren technology, everything I do is for the sake of the Sakura Empire's future.
Using the power of the gods... No, growing addicted and reliant upon the gods' blessings... the Sakura Empire has no future if we continue to follow the old ways.
What I desire is a world free from that... and I'm sure "that person" sees things the same way.
But know this, Akagi. If the Sirens' technology was truly capable of bringing about the future you seek, I would have sided with you.
From what I have seen, you are not the one using the Sirens. They are the ones using you.
...The Sirens' power is intoxicating. It is easy to control, but it is just as easy to lose yourself to it.
The path you walk is now distorted. I fear that if you continue down this path, you will soon turn your blade against your own people.
And I am sure that you would not want "that person" to see you like that.
Pardon me for saying this, Mikasa, but...
What exactly is this "righteous path" that is spoken of so highly in the Sakura Empire?
Would you condemn yourself to a future within the Azur Lane, content to merely break even with the Sirens, settling with a false peace, and pretending to be friends?
While people are still willing to fight, we must press forward. Otherwise, we will be shackled and enslaved one day.
Mikasa, are you saying that all the sacrifices that we've had to make so far were unavoidable?
Wooooaaaahhhh!
Hibiki, who was in the process of preparing for the ceremony's continuation, made her grand entrance... on the verge of tumbling over.
Sorry about that! Lost my balance again for a moment!
Oh, Lady Nagato, I've finished the preparations for the rehearsal ceremony!
Nagato - the head miko of the Sakura Empire - and Kawakaze, followed Hibiki to the center of the ceremony hall.
All of you have acted with the Sakura Empire's best interests in mind, and I know this fact better than anyone else. That is why, at least during this ceremony, let us make peace with one another.
Not just for my sake, but also for each other. That is the way to please the gods.
Nagato faced Watatsumi and offered a prayer for the Sakura Empire.
"Lift your voices in praise of Watatsumi. Show your courage, and admire its wisdom."
"Sing its praises so that it may guide us to the path of light."
"May our lands be forever blessed to stave away calamity."
...But nothing seemed to happen.
As I thought... My words alone are not enough to reach the gods.
Mikasa! The enemy known as "Ember" managed to escape from us... and she's headed towards --
What?!
"Ember" suddenly appeared at the entrance to the ceremony hall, and everyone turned to face her in shock...
...everyone, except for Akagi and Kaga.
You're... Takao?!
Lady Nagato, stand down. I do not wish to point my blade at my people.
Nagato fearlessly placed herself between "Ember" and Watatsumi, signaling her intent to protect it.
Unless you state your reason for seeking Watatsumi's destruction, I cannot yield to you.
...The thing known as "Watatsumi" is not a sacred artifact, but a manifestation of calamity.
By feeding upon the negative emotions throughout the land, it eventually ushers forth untold destruction.
This ritual long predates my existence. I cannot simply take your word at face value.
That history is false. This stone does not exist in your world.
...Come forth!
A blade extended towards Nagato at an inhuman speed.
Lady Nagato!
Kawakaze drew her sword, her reflexes surging as she tried to intercept the attack.
A silence soon fell across the room. Mikasa and Hibiki, who both began to run forward, came to a stop.
As if lightning had struck, the deed was done before anyone in the hall could react.
Lady Nagato... is unharmed...?
I am fine.
Watatsumi, still hidden behind Nagato's back, was cleanly split in half.
No... Watatsumi...!
...This is a fake. Did you hide the real one away beforehand?
A regular stone coated luminescent paint, tinkered with some Siren technology, and imbued with a Sakura Empire defensive charm...
Hmph... Looks like I've wasted my time here.
